Why FindFace

We have the world's best algorithm developed in-house behind all of our technologies. Our facial recognition algorithms are acknowledged to have the best performance on the most influential independent benchmarks.

Explore Core Technologies

Tab 1

Tab 2

The quality of our solutions is guaranteed by the world's best algorithm. NtechLab top performance is confirmed by IARPA and NIST.

IARPA FRPC. Face Recognition Prize Challenge is hosted by the Intelligence Advanced Research Projects Activity (IARPA). The goal of the competition is to find the most effective face recognition algorithms and increase the accuracy of face recognition on wild images.

NtechLab is the winner of the renowned competition in two categories out of three: "Verification accuracy" and "Identification speed".

NIST FRVT. A testing of face recognition algorithms by the U.S. National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST), a non-regulatory federal agency within the U.S. Department of Commerce. NtechLab outperformed more than 80 algorithms all over the world.

WIDER FACE AND PEDESTRIAN CHALLENGE
The Challenge addresses the problem of detecting pedestrians and cyclist in unconstrained environments

The III best performance on the detection of pedestrians and cyclists in images collected from surveillance cameras

Upcoming Releases

Path Tracking

Tracks the silhouette and path of a person passing by the camera:

  • Accurate people count
  • Effective in big crowds where people obscure each other.
  • Effective coupled with face recognition or as a stand-alone.
Ethnicity Recognition

Facial recognition algorithms analyze photographic images for the characteristics visible to an untrained eye. We can determine with good accuracy age, gender and certain emotions, as well as if the person is wearing sunglasses or a mustache.

face recognition technologies
